intro: Conophytum meleagris, commonly known as the "Coral Spurge," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rounded shape and fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the summer months, typically in clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Conophytum meleagris is often cultivated for its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
